intro: Stillingia sylvatica f. minor, commonly known as the lesser stillingia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in many regions.
